content.description: Climb the obvious tang colored inside corner to the roof and traverse up and left onto the face, Once on the face (clip pin) make the difficult face move into the crack (crux) and follow the crack to the bolted anchors.
content.protection: Standard rack, maby doubles on hand and large finger sizes for a beginner.
content.location: The first route on the east side of the cliff, the obvious tang colored left facing corner.

content.description: This is a really fun mellow climb, climb the stmming finger crack up to the small birch tree go right around it and to the bolt anchors shared with fat crack, a fantastic day cap.
content.location: 50 feet right of Tang Corner, just below a striking finger crack.

content.description: Climb the corner past a loose black 30 feet up, move left past a roof to a ledge w/ a birch, from there go up to a cedar belay 70 feet. (good chance the anchor webbing is old due to the lack of traffic on this route)
content.location: 30 feet right of Sundowner. Right facing corner with orange rock on the left wall.

content.description:
Start by bushwacking through some moss and shrubs that have taken root at the base of the climb.  Once past the vegetation, clip a bolt and move onto a slab with vertical cracks.  Follow these up until they run out, and then move left through awkward terrain and suspect rock (I broke a block off here and went for a ride) to gain the right facing corner beneath a prominent roof.  Fun moves bring you past the roof on the right and through a series of overhangs up and left to the chains.

 I would have given this route 3 stars if the start was less of a jungle and that block hadn't exploded - the moves up through the corner and roofs are really fun.
content.protection: One bolt.  Gear to 3" and small to medium stoppers.  70 meter rope necessary to lower off.
content.location: A detached flake leans against the wall about 40 feet right of the prominent thin black streak that marks the left end of the Circus Wall section of the cliff.  High Wire starts just to the right of this detached flake.  The approach trail brings you to the cliff about 40 feet to the right of this route.

content.description: Climb up the right side of the black face directly up the the roof w/ a bolt line above, clip the bolt and pull the crimpy sequence through the roof (crux) and follow the bolts to the fixed anchor shared w/ Frick and Frack.
content.location: 40 feet right of the tang corner on a grey arete

content.description: Up and right around the ceiling (blue camalot size), onto the smooth black face. Up the 2 cracks (optional) to the left notch in the ceiling 60 feet up, pull the roof from its left corner and fall into a crack above, follow this to the shared anchor with Frack.
content.location: small open book 10 feet under a roof. 20 feet right of the tang corner.

content.description: Up and right to a small open book 15 feet up, over the ceiling to a crack in the black face. Climb the crack to the roof and up the right side of the square notch cut out of the roof, then into a crack to the shared anchor with Frick.

Climb the broken flakes up onto the face, climb past the two bolts until under the roof, plug some very solid pro in the roof (purple .5 camalot helpful) pull the wild roof into a crack (crux). Follow the crack to the top and traverse left to the shared anchor with Tang Corner.
content.location: 10 feet right of the tang corner up the broken wide crack onto the face (just under the bolts).

content.description: Often over looked are the offwith's at most craig's but id suggest this one, the quality of rock on this juggy crack is just spectacular. Climb up the hand crack the evolves into a gaping off with up to a fixed anchor, its hard to get lost on this one. This climb is surprisingly secure.
content.protection: from hand sizes up to a helpful 4.5 or 5 inch cam.
content.location: The only off with around, 45 feet right of tang corner at a opening hand crack.

content.description: Thoughtful climbing on a clean face for the first 40 feet. Around the last bolt the rock becomes a bit dirtier. Make a hard move up off of thin holds (crux), then move left to the anchors.
content.location: Falling Kaiser Zone is located at the far right end of the Circus Wall. It is the clean, bolted face approximately 30 feet right of where the approach tail meets the cliff.

content.description: Sleeping beauty is a popular day hike from a secluded trail head known as Dacy's Clearing. Several cliff bands lay rest on the mountain, the lowest of which have the concentration of established routes. This cliff does a great job of providing spectacular views of the lake from the cliff top, and there's more than enough great routes to keep you busy for the day. Rock quality varies but routes have been put in on the better rock and the quality is fantastic.
